definition: to have the full responsibility of a job/allocated task
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
a system of payment partly in kind and partly in cash
erhua variant of 包乾|包干[bao1 gan1]

sentences.english: I bought a loaf of bread at the baker's.
sentences.chinese: 这面包干了，我得去同面包师说一说。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to the preparation process of dry vibrating material for middle ladle.
sentences.chinese: 本发明涉及一种中间包干式振动料的制备方法。

sentences.english: Caesar Salad with Garlic Croutons, Bacon, Quail Eggs and White Anchovies.
sentences.chinese: 凯撒沙律配蒜香面包干，培根，鹌鹑蛋伴白凤尾鱼。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the effect of the application of sickbed capitation in clinical attendance.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨床位包干制管理在临床护理中应用的效果。

sentences.english: The policy of taking full responsibility for a task helps to heighten the farmers' enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大包干儿，有利于提高农民生产积极性。

definition: a system of payment partly in kind and partly in cash
balance due/small balance still to pay/final remaining debt
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
(after a sum has been paid in advance) to refund (in case of overpayment) or be reimbursed (in case of underpayment)
to assist in managing (e.g. traffic police or crowd control)/to steward
work point (measure of work completed in a rural commune in the PRC during the planned economy era)
